intro: Beilschmiedia weii, commonly known as the Guiana beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America, particularly found in the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark-barked trunk and elliptical, glossy green leaves. Beilschmiedia weii produces small, white flowers followed by edible, round fruits that are yellow when mature. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food for various wildlife species.
